page.title: 06TRANSPORT AND TRAVEL
page.content:
Most people in our area travel by road. They use cars, coaches or ride bicycles or motor-bicycles. Goods are moved in vans and lorries. The quickest transport from city to city in Britain is by train. People go from country to country by sea or air. Ships take heavy goods and aeroplanes take lighter parcels. People go by air because it is quicker for long journeys. People who are very rich go by private aeroplanes. The biggest airports in Britain are Gatwick and Heathrow.
Written by John E. Corcoran
